alert.note: Alert for Keith (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 24 at 6:45PM CDT until June 24 at 7:15PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM MDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN ARTHUR AND NORTHEASTERN KEITH COUNTIES... At 545 PM MDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Lemoyne, or 9 miles north of Ogallala, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damage to vehicles is expected. Locations impacted include... Lemoyne, Keystone, Kingsley Dam and Big Bald Hill. This includes the following highways... Highway 61 between mile markers 95 and 109. Highway 92 between mile markers 130 and 138. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...<50 MPH
info.instruction: This storm is producing large hail. SEEK SHELTER NOW inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows. If on or near Lake McConaughy, get away from the water and move indoors or inside a vehicle. remember, lightning can strike out to 15 miles from the parent thunderstorm. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Move to safe shelter now! Do not be caught on the water in a thunderstorm.
